metadata.title: CVE-2022-48937 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:io_uring: add a schedule point in io_add_buffers()Looping ~65535 times doing kmalloc() calls can trigger soft lockups,especially with DEBUG features (like KASAN).[  253.536212] watchdog: BUG: soft lockup - CPU#64 stuck for 26s![b219417889:12575][  253.544433] Modules linked in: vfat fat i2c_mux_pca954x i2c_mux spidevcdc_acm xhci_pci xhci_hcd sha3_generic gq(O)[  253.544451] CPU: 64 PID: 12575 Comm: b219417889 Tainted: G S         O   5.17.0-smp-DEV #801[  253.544457] RIP: 0010:kernel_text_address(./include/asm-generic/sections.h:192 ./include/linux/kallsyms.h:29kernel/extable.c:67 kernel/extable.c:98)[  253.544464] Code: 0f 93 c0 48 c7 c1 e0 63 d7 a4 48 39 cb 0f 92 c1 20 c10f b6 c1 5b 5d c3 90 0f 1f 44 00 00 55 48 89 e5 41 57 41 56 53 48 89 fb<48> c7 c0 00 00 80 a0 41 be 01 00 00 00 48 39 c7 72 0c 48 c7 c0 40[  253.544468] RSP: 0018:ffff8882d8baf4c0 EFLAGS: 00000246[  253.544471] RAX: 1ffff1105b175e00 RBX: ffffffffa13ef09a RCX:00000000a13ef001[  253.544474] RDX: ffffffffa13ef09a RSI: ffff8882d8baf558 RDI:ffffffffa13ef09a[  253.544476] RBP: ffff8882d8baf4d8 R08: ffff8882d8baf5e0 R09:0000000000000004[  253.544479] R10: ffff8882d8baf5e8 R11: ffffffffa0d59a50 R12:ffff8882eab20380[  253.544481] R13: ffffffffa0d59a50 R14: dffffc0000000000 R15:1ffff1105b175eb0[  253.544483] FS:  00000000016d3380(0000) GS:ffff88af48c00000(0000)knlGS:0000000000000000[  253.544486] CS:  0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033[  253.544488] CR2: 00000000004af0f0 CR3: 00000002eabfa004 CR4:00000000003706e0[  253.544491] DR0: 0000000000000000 DR1: 0000000000000000 DR2:0000000000000000[  253.544492] DR3: 0000000000000000 DR6: 00000000fffe0ff0 DR7:0000000000000400[  253.544494] Call Trace:[  253.544496]  <TASK>[  253.544498] ?     Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48937` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
